subject: UBA BANK GROUP UGANDAN.
body:
UBA BANK GROUP UGANDAN.
 (UBA) LINERPOOL, M60 4EP
 E-mail:charlesdonglasjr@gmail.com
 PHONE: +256 7083-360801
 Contact person: Charles Victor Douglas Jr
 Director/ Foreign Affairs Ops Dept.
 YOUR ONLINE BANK WIRE TRANSFER
 The Remittance of Your Fund $8.5Million To Your Personal Bank Account: I
 believe you are alive and doing well to be reading this important and urgent
 E-mail from the sub-regional office of the UBA Republic of Uganda, I am writing
 you this mail with urgent concern to officially inform you that our GPS
 Network Server System (GPS NSS) recently detected an unknown Fund
Transfer Payment File
 system
 (FTP File) valued at $8.5million,after our investigation on the FTP file we
 discovered your name and data information on the file confirming you as the
 Payment Receiver so we presented the FTP file to the World Bank Department of
 Europe sub-region, so therefore we have now been authorized to wire this fund
 directly to your Personal Bank Account because your Fund Transfer Payment file
 was officially
 cleared with a Bill of Clean Sheet as your name and data information was
 clearly verified on the FTP file that was detected by our GPS NSS.We also wish
 to inform you that a Domiciliary Account must be opened for you here in this
 our bank where your fund must be lodged in before it is properly processed for
 our Online Bank Transfer, so 
you are also requested to fill out the Account
 Opening Form as requested
 below,REQUESTED INFORMATION FOR NEW ACCOUNT (Non
 residential account)

 Finally, do bear in mind that once we confirm the requested information above
 from you we shall effect your Fund Transfer within 24/48hrs immediately. If you
 have any question or inquiry please feel free to call our Customer Fulfillment
 Center On +256 7083-360801 Thank you for
 your understanding as we hope to hear
 from you soon.
 Regards,
 Charles Douglas Jr
 Phone Number: +256 7083-360801
 Email: 
charlesdonglasjr@gmail.com
 Regional Director
 UBA Bank Online Services
 Republic Of Ugandan
.

subject: Re: UBA BANK GROUP UGANDAN.
body:
Hello,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I hope this email finds you well. I received your message regarding the remittance of funds to my personal bank account. I must say, it sounds quite interesting.

I have a few questions before proceeding with any further steps. Firstly, could you please provide more details about the origin of these funds? How did my name and data end up on the FTP file? Secondly, what is the total amount of funds that will be transferred to my account?

Additionally, I would like to know more about UBA Bank Group in Uganda. Could you please share some information about the bank's history and reputation? It would be helpful for me to understand more about your organization before proceeding.

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Howard

subject: Re: UBA BANK GROUP UGANDAN.
body:
UBA BANK GROUP UGANDA.
(UBA) LINERPOOL, M60 4EP
E-mail:charlesdonglasjr@gmail.com
Contact person: Charles Victor Douglas Jr

Director/ Foreign Affairs Ops Dept.

ATTENTION DEAR CUSTOMER

We acknowledge the receipt of your mail

This is to confirm to you that we have received an irrevocable
instruction from the office of the Presidency and the Ministry of
Justice and Bank of Africa to affect the transfer of your fund to your
foreign account. However, your payment file was submitted to our
United Bank For Africa (UBA) to transfer your ($8.5Million) into
your nominated bank account. Today the board of directors (UBA) had
their final meeting concerning your fund and we came into conclusion that
your fund should be transferred into your account as soon as you send us the
cost of Domiciliary Or Non Residence account Opening fee.

To this effect, after a long deliberation with the board of directors
and the ministry of (UBA BANK) of Republic of Ugandan including the Company
where this fund was deposited before, we hereby confirm to you that
the payment have been approved to be paid to you without further delay
as soon as you open  new account in our (UBA)  Online Bank.

To open Domiciliary Or Non Residence online new accounts with us to enable
you have full access to your fund, you are advise to send the cost of $185
being
for UBA BANK Online Account Opening Form and return back with the account
opening fee of $185 and send it to the name of our cashier Name by
western union or money gram or Bank Transfer or Bitcoin to Uganda. Email us
with the
details of payment.


We sincerely hope that the above requirement will be sent to us sooner than
let us proceed with the opening of the new account with your name
so that you can transfer your funds by yourself. Please note that we
cannot carry on with the Transfer of your money to you until you have been
able to meet up with the requirement of the transfer of your funds.

Note that we have a period of (2) working days to conclude this
matter.we  wait for your early response to move ahead.

Thank you for your understanding as I am looking forward to hearing a
positive response from you immediately.


 Regards,
 Charles Victor Douglas Jr
 Email: charlesdonglasjr@gmail.com
 Regional Director
 UBA Bank Online Services

subject: Re: UBA BANK GROUP UGANDAN.
body:
Hello,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I appreciate the information you have provided regarding the transfer of my funds. I just have a few questions before proceeding.

1. Can you please explain in more detail what the Or Non Residence account is and why it is necessary for me to open one?

2. What are the benefits of having an account with UBA Online Bank? How will it help me access my funds?

3. Could you provide more information about the cost of opening the account? Is there a specific reason why it needs to be paid through Western Union, MoneyGram, Bank Transfer, or Bitcoin?

I look forward to your response and further guidance on how to proceed.

Best wishes,
Howard

subject: Re: UBA BANK GROUP UGANDAN.
body:
Hello Howard

Thank you for your email
Non Residence account Is an account you can open
Central location based in a country or territory you don’t live in, it’s
referred as offshore bank  account ,

(2)Having online banking account is for easy you can use transfer your
funds of the $8.5million usd into your personal bank account

(3)Payment through bitcoin or western union or money gram is the payment
method you can use send this $185usd for the Non Residence account,

So you have to tell me the payment system that’s is for you to send whether
bitcoin or public sender like western union or money grace ok

Sincerely
Charles

subject: Re: UBA BANK GROUP UGANDAN.
body:
Hello Charles,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I appreciate the information you provided about the Non Residence account. It sounds interesting, but I have a few questions before proceeding.

1. Can you please explain in more detail how the offshore bank account works? What are the benefits of having one?

2. How secure is the online banking system for this account? Are there any additional security measures in place to protect my funds?

3. Could you provide some examples of situations where someone might find it beneficial to have a Non Residence account?

4. Regarding the payment methods, I'm not very familiar with bitcoin. Could you explain how it works and why it would be a good option for this transaction?

Thank you again for your time and assistance.

Best wishes,
Howard

subject: Re: UBA BANK GROUP UGANDAN.
body:
Hello Charles,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I appreciate the information you provided about the Non Residence account. It sounds interesting, but I have a few questions before proceeding.

1. Can you please explain in more detail how the offshore bank account works? What are the benefits of having one?

2. How secure is the online banking system for this account? Are there any additional security measures in place to protect my funds?

3. Could you provide some examples of situations where someone might find it beneficial to have a Non Residence account?

4. Regarding the payment methods, I'm not very familiar with bitcoin. Could you explain how it works and why it would be a good option for this transaction? Alternatively, what are the advantages of using Western Union or MoneyGram?

Thank you again for your assistance.

Best wishes,
